maml:description.maml:para: Modifies configuration settings for a RemoteApp program.
The Set-RDRemoteApp cmdlet modifies configuration settings for a Windows Server 2012 RemoteApp program that runs in a Remote Desktop deployment.

RemoteApp allows Remote Desktop Services (RDS) to run a program remotely that appears as if it runs locally on a client computer. A RemoteApp program runs in its own resizable window and has its own entry on the taskbar.
Specifies the name of a virtual desktop collection or session collection.

Specifies whether the RemoteApp program accepts command-line arguments from the client at connection time. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Allow. Accepts command-line arguments. -- DoNotAllow. Does not accept command-line arguments. -- Require. Allows only command-line arguments specified in the RequiredCommandLine parameter.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a Remote Desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies a name to display to users for the RemoteApp program.

Specifies a path for the executable file for the application. Do not include any environment variables. For session collections, this path must be a valid local path on all Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) servers in the collection. For virtual desktop collections, this path must be a valid local path on all virtual desktops in the collection.
Specifies a path for the application executable file. This path resolves to the same location as the value of the FilePath parameter, but it can include environment variables.
Specifies the name of the folder that the RemoteApp program appears in on the Remote Desktop Web Access (RD Web Access) webpage and in the Start menu for subscribed RemoteApp and Desktop Connections.
Specifies the index in the icon file for the RemoteApp program icon. The IconPath parameter specifies the icon file.

Specifies the path to a file containing the icon to display for the RemoteApp program identified by the Alias parameter. This path must not contain any environment variables. For session collections, the path must be a valid local path on all RD Session Host servers in the collection. For virtual desktop collections, the path must be a valid local path on all virtual desktops in the collection.

Specifies a string that contains command-line arguments that the client can use at connection time with the RemoteApp program. If you specify this parameter, the CommandLineSetting parameter must have a value of Require.
Specifies whether to show the RemoteApp program in the RD Web Access server, and in RemoteApp and Desktop Connections that the user subscribes to.

Specifies an array of domain groups and users that can view the RemoteApp in RD Web Access, and in RemoteApp and Desktop Connections. To allow all users to see a RemoteApp program, provide a value of $Null.
Specifies an alias for the RemoteApp program. This alias must be unique within the collection specified by the CollectionName parameter.
Specifies the name of a virtual desktop collection or session collection.

Specifies whether the RemoteApp program accepts command-line arguments from the client at connection time. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- Allow. Accepts command-line arguments. -- DoNotAllow. Does not accept command-line arguments. -- Require. Allows only command-line arguments specified in the RequiredCommandLine parameter.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a Remote Desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies a name to display to users for the RemoteApp program.

Specifies a path for the executable file for the application. Do not include any environment variables. For session collections, this path must be a valid local path on all Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) servers in the collection. For virtual desktop collections, this path must be a valid local path on all virtual desktops in the collection.
Specifies a path for the application executable file. This path resolves to the same location as the value of the FilePath parameter, but it can include environment variables.
Specifies the name of the folder that the RemoteApp program appears in on the Remote Desktop Web Access (RD Web Access) webpage and in the Start menu for subscribed RemoteApp and Desktop Connections.
Specifies the index in the icon file for the RemoteApp program icon. The IconPath parameter specifies the icon file.

Specifies the path to a file containing the icon to display for the RemoteApp program identified by the Alias parameter. This path must not contain any environment variables. For session collections, the path must be a valid local path on all RD Session Host servers in the collection. For virtual desktop collections, the path must be a valid local path on all virtual desktops in the collection.

Specifies a string that contains command-line arguments that the client can use at connection time with the RemoteApp program. If you specify this parameter, the CommandLineSetting parameter must have a value of Require.
Specifies whether to show the RemoteApp program in the RD Web Access server, and in RemoteApp and Desktop Connections that the user subscribes to.

Specifies an array of domain groups and users that can view the RemoteApp in RD Web Access, and in RemoteApp and Desktop Connections. To allow all users to see a RemoteApp program, provide a value of $Null.
Specifies an alias for the RemoteApp program. This alias must be unique within the collection specified by the CollectionName parameter.

Specifies the name of a virtual desktop. The icon file specified in the IconPath parameter resides in this virtual desktop. The virtual desktop must be a member of the collection specified by the CollectionName parameter.
Specifies an alias for the RemoteApp program. This alias must be unique within the collection specified by the CollectionName parameter.

-- Allow. Accepts command-line arguments. -- DoNotAllow. Does not accept command-line arguments. -- Require. Allows only command-line arguments specified in the RequiredCommandLine parameter.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a Remote Desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.

For session collections, this path must be a valid local path on all Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) servers in the collection. For virtual desktop collections, this path must be a valid local path on all virtual desktops in the collection.
Specifies a path for the application executable file. This path resolves to the same location as the value of the FilePath parameter, but it can include environment variables.
Specifies the name of the folder that the RemoteApp program appears in on the Remote Desktop Web Access (RD Web Access) webpage and in the Start menu for subscribed RemoteApp and Desktop Connections.
Specifies the index in the icon file for the RemoteApp program icon. The IconPath parameter specifies the icon file.

Specifies the path to a file containing the icon to display for the RemoteApp program identified by the Alias parameter. This path must not contain any environment variables. For session collections, the path must be a valid local path on all RD Session Host servers in the collection. For virtual desktop collections, the path must be a valid local path on all virtual desktops in the collection.

Specifies a string that contains command-line arguments that the client can use at connection time with the RemoteApp program. If you specify this parameter, the CommandLineSetting parameter must have a value of Require.
Specifies whether to show the RemoteApp program in the RD Web Access server, and in RemoteApp and Desktop Connections that the user subscribes to.

Specifies an array of domain groups and users that can view the RemoteApp in RD Web Access, and in RemoteApp and Desktop Connections. To allow all users to see a RemoteApp program, provide a value of $Null.

Specifies the name of a virtual desktop. The icon file specified in the IconPath parameter resides in this virtual desktop. The virtual desktop must be a member of the collection specified by the CollectionName parameter.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Modify settings for a RemoteApp program
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-RDRemoteApp -CollectionName "Virtual Desktop Collection" -Alias "IE" –VirtualDesktopName "RDS-WKS-A27" -FolderName "Websites" -CommandLineSetting Require -RequiredCommandLine "http://www.bing.com"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command modifies settings for a RemoteApp program in the collection named Virtual Desktop Collection. The command specifies IE as an alias, and specifies Websites as the folder where the RemoteApp program appears. The command specifies the virtual desktop name RDS-WKS-A27. This command uses a required command line argument. This RemoteApp opens the specified browser to go to the specified URL.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Modify user and group settings for a RemoteApp program
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-RDRemoteApp -CollectionName "Session Collection" -Alias "Notepad" -FolderName "Admin Tools" -UserGroups @("contoso\Domain Admins")

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command modifies settings for a RemoteApp program in the collection named Session Collection. The command specifies Notepad as an alias for the program, and specifies the Admin Tools as the folder where this RemoteApp program appears. The command also specifies the users and groups that can see the program.

maml:description.maml:para: Changes whether to publish a Remote Desktop to a collection.
The Set-RDRemoteDesktop cmdlet changes whether to publish a Remote Desktop connection to a collection.

When you publish a Remote Desktop connection, the Remote Desktop Web Access (RD Web Access) server displays the Remote Desktop connection for the collection defined by the CollectionName parameter. RemoteApp and Desktop Connections that the user subscribes to also display published Remote Desktop connections.

You can publish either RemoteApps or a Remote Desktop connection to a collection, but not both. Therefore, if you publish a Remote Desktop connection by using this cmdlet, it unpublishes any published RemoteApps.
Specifies the name of a personal virtual desktop collection.
Specifies whether to publish a Remote Desktop connection.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a Remote Desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the name of a personal virtual desktop collection.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a Remote Desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies whether to publish a Remote Desktop connection.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Publish a Remote Desktop

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command publishes a Remote Desktop to the collection named Session Collection. The ShowInWebAccess parameter has a value of $True, therefore the collection appears in RD Web Access. RemoteApp and Desktop Connections that the user subscribes to also display the collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies configuration options for an existing session collection.

The Set-RDSessionCollectionConfiguration cmdlet modifies configuration options for an existing session collection. A session collection consists of one or more Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) servers. Users can connect to RD Session Host servers in a session collection to run programs, save files, and use resources on those servers.
You can use the New-RDSessionCollection cmdlet to create a session collection.
Specifies the name of a session collection.
Specifies the maximum time, in minutes, an active session runs. After this period, the RD Session Host server ends the session.
Indicates whether to use Network Level Authentication (NLA). If this value is $True, Remote Desktop uses NLA to authenticate a user before the user sees a logon screen.
Indicates whether the Remote Desktop client attempts to reconnect after a connection interruption.

Specifies an action for an RD Session Host server to take after a connection interruption. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- None -- Disconnect -- LogOff

Specifies a type of client device to be redirected to an RD Session Host server in this session collection. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- 0x0000. None. -- 0x0001. AudioVideoPlayBack. -- 0x0002. AudioRecording. -- 0x0004. COMPort. -- 0x0008. PlugAndPlayDevice. -- 0x0010. SmartCard. -- 0x0020. Clipboard. -- 0x0040. LPTPort. -- 0x0080. Drive. -- 0x0100. TimeZone.
You can use binary-or to combine two or more values of this enum to specify multiple client device types.
Indicates whether to use the client printer or server printer as the default printer. If this value is $True, use the client printer as default. If this value is $False, use the server as default.
Indicates whether to use client printer redirection, which routes print jobs from the Remote Desktop session to a printer attached to the client computer.
Specifies a description of the session collection.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a Remote Desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) settings to include in the .rdp files for all Windows Server 2012 RemoteApp programs and remote desktops published in this collection.
Specifies a length of time, in minutes. After client disconnection from a session for this period, the RD Session Host ends the session.

Specifies the level of data encryption used for a Remote Desktop session. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- 0. Low. -- 1. ClientCompatible. -- 2. High. -- 3. FipsCompliant.
The default value is ClientCompatible.
Specifies the length of time, in minutes, to wait before an RD Session Host logs off or disconnects an idle session. The BrokenConnectionAction parameter determines whether to log off or disconnect.

Specifies an array of objects that defines load balancing guidelines for the remote session collection. Each object specifies the collection name, RD Session Host server name, relative weight to use for that server, and a maximum number of sessions to allow.
Specifies the maximum number of client monitors that an RD Session Host server can redirect to a remote session. The highest value for this parameter is 16.
Specifies whether to enable the Remote Desktop Easy Print driver.

Specifies which security protocol to use. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- 0. RDP. -- 1. Negotiate. -- 2. SSL.
The default value is Negotiate.
Specifies whether to delete temporary folders from the RD Session Host server for a disconnected session.

Specifies whether to use a single folder for temporary files. If this value is $True, a single folder contains temporary files. If this value is $False, individual users have separate folders to store temporary files.
Specifies an array of domain groups and users authorized to connect to the RD Session Host servers in a session collection.
Specifies the name of a session collection.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a Remote Desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Indicates that Remote Desktop does not use a user profile to configure the session collection.
Specifies the name of a session collection.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a Remote Desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.

Specifies an array of file paths to exclude from a user profile disk. By default, Remote Desktop creates standard file and folder paths, such as Documents and Music. Use this parameter to prevent creation of specified file paths. This parameter overrides any identical values specified in the IncludeFilePath or IncludeFolderPath parameters.

Specifies an array of folder paths to exclude from a user profile disk. By default, Remote Desktop creates standard file and folder paths, such as Documents and Music. Use this parameter to prevent creation of specified folder paths. This parameter overrides any identical values specified in the IncludeFilePath or IncludeFolderPath parameters.
Specifies an array of file paths to include in a user profile disk.
Specifies an array of folder paths to include in a user profile disk.
Specifies a path for the user profile disk.

Indicates that Remote Desktop uses a user profile disk to configure the session collection. A user profile disk stores user profile information as a separate virtual hard disk in order to persist user profile settings across a pool of virtual desktops.
Specifies the maximum size, in gigabytes, for a user profile disk.
Specifies the maximum time, in minutes, an active session runs. After this period, the RD Session Host server ends the session.
Indicates whether to use Network Level Authentication (NLA). If this value is $True, Remote Desktop uses NLA to authenticate a user before the user sees a logon screen.
Indicates whether the Remote Desktop client attempts to reconnect after a connection interruption.

Specifies an action for an RD Session Host server to take after a connection interruption. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- None -- Disconnect -- LogOff

Specifies a type of client device to be redirected to an RD Session Host server in this session collection. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- 0x0000. None. -- 0x0001. AudioVideoPlayBack. -- 0x0002. AudioRecording. -- 0x0004. COMPort. -- 0x0008. PlugAndPlayDevice. -- 0x0010. SmartCard. -- 0x0020. Clipboard. -- 0x0040. LPTPort. -- 0x0080. Drive. -- 0x0100. TimeZone.
You can use binary-or to combine two or more values of this enum to specify multiple client device types.
Indicates whether to use the client printer or server printer as the default printer. If this value is $True, use the client printer as default. If this value is $False, use the server as default.
Indicates whether to use client printer redirection, which routes print jobs from the Remote Desktop session to a printer attached to the client computer.
Specifies a description of the session collection.
Specifies the name of a session collection.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a Remote Desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) settings to include in the .rdp files for all Windows Server 2012 RemoteApp programs and remote desktops published in this collection.
Indicates that Remote Desktop does not use a user profile to configure the session collection.
Specifies a length of time, in minutes. After client disconnection from a session for this period, the RD Session Host ends the session.
Specifies a path for the user profile disk.

Indicates that Remote Desktop uses a user profile disk to configure the session collection. A user profile disk stores user profile information as a separate virtual hard disk in order to persist user profile settings across a pool of virtual desktops.

Specifies the level of data encryption used for a Remote Desktop session. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- 0. Low. -- 1. ClientCompatible. -- 2. High. -- 3. FipsCompliant.
The default value is ClientCompatible.

Specifies an array of file paths to exclude from a user profile disk. By default, Remote Desktop creates standard file and folder paths, such as Documents and Music. Use this parameter to prevent creation of specified file paths. This parameter overrides any identical values specified in the IncludeFilePath or IncludeFolderPath parameters.

Specifies an array of folder paths to exclude from a user profile disk. By default, Remote Desktop creates standard file and folder paths, such as Documents and Music. Use this parameter to prevent creation of specified folder paths. This parameter overrides any identical values specified in the IncludeFilePath or IncludeFolderPath parameters.
Specifies the length of time, in minutes, to wait before an RD Session Host logs off or disconnects an idle session. The BrokenConnectionAction parameter determines whether to log off or disconnect.
Specifies an array of file paths to include in a user profile disk.
Specifies an array of folder paths to include in a user profile disk.

Specifies an array of objects that defines load balancing guidelines for the remote session collection. Each object specifies the collection name, RD Session Host server name, relative weight to use for that server, and a maximum number of sessions to allow.
Specifies the maximum number of client monitors that an RD Session Host server can redirect to a remote session. The highest value for this parameter is 16.
Specifies the maximum size, in gigabytes, for a user profile disk.
Specifies whether to enable the Remote Desktop Easy Print driver.

Specifies which security protocol to use. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- 0. RDP. -- 1. Negotiate. -- 2. SSL.
The default value is Negotiate.
Specifies whether to delete temporary folders from the RD Session Host server for a disconnected session.

Specifies whether to use a single folder for temporary files. If this value is $True, a single folder contains temporary files. If this value is $False, individual users have separate folders to store temporary files.
Specifies an array of domain groups and users authorized to connect to the RD Session Host servers in a session collection.

maml:alert.maml:para: The IncludeFolderPath and IncludeFilePath parameters are mutually exclusive with the ExcludeFolderPath and ExcludeFilePath parameters.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Disable user profile disk

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command configures a session collection to not use a user profile disk for a session collection named Session Collection 02 that has an RD Connection Broker named RDCB.Contoso.com.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Specify a user profile disk with included file and folder
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-RDSessionCollectionConfiguration -CollectionName "Session Collection 09" -EnableUserProfileDisk -MaxUserProfileDiskSizeGB 40 -DiskPath "C:\UserVHDs" -IncludeFolderPath "C:\Resources Folder" -IncludeFileFolderPath "C:\Required Text File.txt" -ConnectionBroker "RDCB.Contoso.com"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command configures a session collection to use a user profile disk for a session collection named Session Collection 09 that has an RD Connection Broker named RDCB.Contoso.com. The command specifies the maximum size of the user profile disk and its disk path. The command specifies a path and file to include in the user profile.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Specify a user profile disk with excluded file and folder
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-RDSessionCollectionConfiguration -CollectionName "Session Collection 19" -EnableUserProfileDisk -MaxUserProfileDiskSizeGB 40 -DiskPath "C:\UserVHDs" -ExcludeFolderPath "C:\Local Resources Folder" -ExcludeFilePath "C:\Local Text File.txt" -ConnectionBroker "RDCD.Contoso.com"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command configures a session collection to use a user profile disk for a session collection named Session Collection 19 that has an RD Connection Broker named RDCB.Contoso.com. The command specifies the maximum size of the user profile disk and its disk path. The command specifies a path and file to exclude from the user profile.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Configure load balancing
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $LoadBalanceObjectsArray = New-Object System.Collections.Generic.List[Microsoft.RemoteDesktopServices.Management.RDSessionHostCollectionLoadBalancingInstance] PS C:\>$LoadBalanceSessionHost1 = New-Object Microsoft.RemoteDesktopServices.Management.RDSessionHostCollectionLoadBalancingInstance( "SessionHostCollection", 50, 200, "RDSH-1.Contoso.com" ) PS C:\> $LoadBalanceObjectsArray.Add($LoadBalanceSessionHost1) PS C:\> $LoadBalanceSessionHost2 = New-Object Microsoft.RemoteDesktopServices.Management.RDSessionHostCollectionLoadBalancingInstance( "SessionHostCollection", 50, 300, "RDSH-2Contoso.com" ) PS C:\> $LoadBalanceObjectsArray.Add($LoadBalanceSessionHost2) PS C:\> Set-RDSessionCollectionConfiguration -CollectionName "Session Collection 07" -LoadBalancing $LoadBalanceObjectsArray -ConnectionBroker "RDCB.Contoso.com"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example configures load balancing for a session collection named Session Collection 07 that has an RD Connection Broker server named RDCB.Contoso.com.

The first five commands use standard Windows PowerShell® syntax to create an array of objects to define load balancing guidelines, and store those guidelines in the $LoadBalanceObjectsArray variable. This example configuration uses two RD Session Host servers named RDSH-1.Contoso.com and RDSH-2.Contoso.com

The final command specifies load balancing settings for the session collection that has the name Session Collection 07 and the RD Connection Broker server named RDCB.Contoso.com. The command uses the array stored in the $LoadBalanceObjectsArray variable to specify load balancing behavior.

maml:description.maml:para: Configures one or more RD Session Host servers in a session collection.

The Set-RDSessionHost cmdlet configures one or more Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) servers in a session collection by specifying whether each server can accept new connections. RD Session Host is a Remote Desktop Services role service that lets users share Windows-based programs or the full Windows desktop. Users can connect to a RD Session Host server to run programs, save files, and use network resources on that server.
Specifies an array that contains the name of one or more RD Session Host servers that you configure.
Determines whether the RD Session Host servers specified by the SessionHost parameter can accept new connections. The acceptable values for this parameter are: Yes, NotUntilReboot, or No.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for this Remote Desktop deployment. If this parameter does not appear, the default value is the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local host.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for this Remote Desktop deployment. If this parameter does not appear, the default value is the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local host.
Determines whether the RD Session Host servers specified by the SessionHost parameter can accept new connections. The acceptable values for this parameter are: Yes, NotUntilReboot, or No.
Specifies an array that contains the name of one or more RD Session Host servers that you configure.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set values for an RD Session Host server

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command specifies values for an RD Session Host server named rdsh.contoso.com. Users can make new server connections to a session collection on the RD Connection Broker server named rdcb.contoso.com.

maml:description.maml:para: Changes configuration settings for a virtual desktop collection.
The Set-RDVirtualDesktopCollectionConfiguration cmdlet changes configuration settings for a virtual desktop collection.
Specifies the name of a personal virtual desktop collection.
Indicates that the server automatically associates virtual desktops with user accounts when you create a new personal virtual desktop collection.

Specifies a type of client device to be redirected to an RD Session Host server in this session collection. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- 0x0000. None. -- 0x0001. AudioVideoPlayBack. -- 0x0002. AudioRecording. -- 0x0004. COMPort. -- 0x0008. PlugAndPlayDevice. -- 0x0010. SmartCard. -- 0x0020. Clipboard. -- 0x0040. LPTPort. -- 0x0080. Drive. -- 0x0100. TimeZone.
You can use binary-or to combine two or more values of this enumeration to specify multiple client device types.
Specifies a description for the collection.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a remote desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) settings to include in the .rdp files for all RemoteApp programs and remote desktops that you publish to this collection.
Indicates whether the server grants administrative privileges to the user account that it assigns to a personal virtual desktop. This parameter applies only to personal virtual desktop collections.
Indicates whether the server redirects all client monitors to the remote session. Specify $False to redirect a single monitor to the remote session.
Indicates whether the server redirects the client printers to the server printer.
Specifies the delay, in minutes, before the server saves a virtual desktop that is not in use.
Specifies an array of user groups that are authorized to connect to the collection.
Specifies the name of a personal virtual desktop collection.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a remote desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Indicates that the server prevents you from using a user profile disk when you configure the collection.
Specifies the name of a personal virtual desktop collection.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a remote desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies an array of file paths that the server excludes when it creates the user profile disk.

By default, the server creates the standard file and folder paths, for example, Documents and Music. Use this parameter with or without the ExcludeFolderPath parameter to prevent the server from creating file or folder paths. This parameter overrides any identical values that you specify in the IncludeFilePath or IncludeFolderPath parameters.
Specifies an array of folder paths that the server excludes when it creates the user profile disk.

By default, the server creates the standard file and folder paths, for example, Documents and Music. Use this parameter with or without the ExcludeFilePath parameter to prevent the server from creating file or folder paths. This parameter overrides any identical values that you specify in the IncludeFilePath or IncludeFolderPath parameters.
Specifies an array of file paths that the server includes when it creates the user profile disk.
By default, the server creates the standard file and folder paths, for example, Documents and Music. Use this parameter with or without the IncludeFolderPath parameter to create file or folder paths.
Specifies an array of folder paths that the server excludes when it creates the user profile disk.
By default, the server creates the standard file and folder paths, for example, Documents and Music. Use this parameter with or without the IncludeFilePath parameter to create file or folder paths.
Specifies the path of the user profile disk.

Indicates that the server enables a user profile disk when you configure the collection. A user profile disk stores user profile information in a separate virtual hard disk and saves user profile settings across pooled virtual desktops.
Specifies the maximum size, in gigabytes, for the user profile disk.
Indicates that the server automatically associates virtual desktops with user accounts when you create a new personal virtual desktop collection.

Specifies a type of client device to be redirected to an RD Session Host server in this session collection. The acceptable values for this parameter are:
-- 0x0000. None. -- 0x0001. AudioVideoPlayBack. -- 0x0002. AudioRecording. -- 0x0004. COMPort. -- 0x0008. PlugAndPlayDevice. -- 0x0010. SmartCard. -- 0x0020. Clipboard. -- 0x0040. LPTPort. -- 0x0080. Drive. -- 0x0100. TimeZone.
You can use binary-or to combine two or more values of this enumeration to specify multiple client device types.
Specifies a description for the collection.
Specifies the name of a personal virtual desktop collection.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a remote desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) settings to include in the .rdp files for all RemoteApp programs and remote desktops that you publish to this collection.
Indicates that the server prevents you from using a user profile disk when you configure the collection.
Specifies the path of the user profile disk.

Indicates that the server enables a user profile disk when you configure the collection. A user profile disk stores user profile information in a separate virtual hard disk and saves user profile settings across pooled virtual desktops.
Specifies an array of file paths that the server excludes when it creates the user profile disk.

By default, the server creates the standard file and folder paths, for example, Documents and Music. Use this parameter with or without the ExcludeFolderPath parameter to prevent the server from creating file or folder paths. This parameter overrides any identical values that you specify in the IncludeFilePath or IncludeFolderPath parameters.
Specifies an array of folder paths that the server excludes when it creates the user profile disk.

By default, the server creates the standard file and folder paths, for example, Documents and Music. Use this parameter with or without the ExcludeFilePath parameter to prevent the server from creating file or folder paths. This parameter overrides any identical values that you specify in the IncludeFilePath or IncludeFolderPath parameters.
Indicates whether the server grants administrative privileges to the user account that it assigns to a personal virtual desktop. This parameter applies only to personal virtual desktop collections.
Specifies an array of file paths that the server includes when it creates the user profile disk.
By default, the server creates the standard file and folder paths, for example, Documents and Music. Use this parameter with or without the IncludeFolderPath parameter to create file or folder paths.
Specifies an array of folder paths that the server excludes when it creates the user profile disk.
By default, the server creates the standard file and folder paths, for example, Documents and Music. Use this parameter with or without the IncludeFilePath parameter to create file or folder paths.
Specifies the maximum size, in gigabytes, for the user profile disk.
Indicates whether the server redirects all client monitors to the remote session. Specify $False to redirect a single monitor to the remote session.
Indicates whether the server redirects the client printers to the server printer.
Specifies the delay, in minutes, before the server saves a virtual desktop that is not in use.
Specifies an array of user groups that are authorized to connect to the collection.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Change the save delay setting for a virtual desktop collection

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command changes the save delay setting for the virtual desktop collection named Virtual Desktop Pool that is associated with the RD Connection Broker server named rdcb.contoso.com. The command specifies a delay of 5 minutes before the server saves a virtual desktop in the virtual desktop collection that is not in use.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Change the user profile disk settings for a virtual desktop collection

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command enables a user profile disk for the virtual desktop collection named Virtual Desktop Pool. The command specifies the maximum size of 10 gigabytes for the user profile disk and specifies the path of the user profile disk.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Change settings for a virtual desktop collection
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Set-RDVirtualDesktopCollectionConfiguration -CollectionName "Virtual Desktop Pool" -CollectionDescription "Virtual Desktop Pool created using PowerShell" -RedirectAllMonitors $False -ConnectionBroker "rdcb.contoso.com" -ClientDeviceRedirectionOptions AudioVideoPlayBack,PlugAndPlayDevice

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command changes configuration settings for the virtual desktop collection named Virtual Desktop Pool. The command adds a description to the virtual desktop collection, specifies that the server redirects a single monitor to the remote session, and specifies that Remote Desktop Services redirect AudioVideoPlayBack and PlugAndPlayDevice client devices to the server in this collection.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the number of virtual desktops that RDS can create in parallel.

The Set-RDVirtualDesktopConcurrency cmdlet sets the number of virtual desktops that Remote Desktop Services (RDS) can create in parallel on Remote Desktop Virtualization Host (RD Virtualization Host) servers.
Specifies the number of virtual desktops that RDS can create in parallel.

Specifies the name of the server that hosts the session. For session collections the host server has the name of the Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) server. For virtual desktop collections the host server has the name of the Remote Desktop Virtualization Host (RD Virtualization Host) server.
Specifies the batch size.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a remote desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies a collection of values (key/value pair) that specify the concurrency factor for each RD Virtualization Host server.
Specifies the batch size.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a remote desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies a collection of values (key/value pair) that specify the concurrency factor for each RD Virtualization Host server.
Specifies the batch size.
Specifies the number of virtual desktops that RDS can create in parallel.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a remote desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.

Specifies the name of the server that hosts the session. For session collections the host server has the name of the Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) server. For virtual desktop collections the host server has the name of the Remote Desktop Virtualization Host (RD Virtualization Host) server.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the number of virtual desktops that RDS can create in parallel on all host servers

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the number of virtual desktops that Remote Desktop Services (RDS) can create in parallel to 4 on all the host servers associated with the RD Connection Broker server named rdcb.contoso.com.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Set the number of virtual desktops that RDS can create in parallel on host servers

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the number of virtual desktops that Remote Desktop Services (RDS) can create in parallel to 3 on the host servers named rdvh-1.contoso.com and rdvh-2.contoso.com.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the maximum number of idle virtual desktops on host servers.

The Set-RDVirtualDesktopIdleCount cmdlet sets the maximum number of active but idle virtual desktops on one or more host servers. This cmdlet sets the total number of virtual desktops that can be idle in all pools.

An idle virtual desktop is a virtual machine that is in a running state and there is no user logged on to it. Idle virtual desktops continue to run even if you configured the pool so that the server saves a virtual desktop that is not in use.
Specifies the number of idle virtual desktops.

Specifies an array of names of the servers that host the session. For session collections the host server has the name of the Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) server. For virtual desktop collections the host server has the name of the Remote Desktop Virtualization Host (RD Virtualization Host) server.
Specifies the batch size.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a remote desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies a collection of values (key/value pair) that allocate idle virtual desktops to Remote Desktop Virtualization (RD Virtualization Host) servers.
Specifies the batch size.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a remote desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies a collection of values (key/value pair) that allocate idle virtual desktops to Remote Desktop Virtualization (RD Virtualization Host) servers.
Specifies the batch size.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a remote desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.

Specifies an array of names of the servers that host the session. For session collections the host server has the name of the Remote Desktop Session Host (RD Session Host) server. For virtual desktop collections the host server has the name of the Remote Desktop Virtualization Host (RD Virtualization Host) server.
Specifies the number of idle virtual desktops.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the number of idle virtual desktops on host servers

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the maximum number of active but idle virtual desktops on the host servers named rdvh-1.contoso.com and rdvh-2.contoso.com.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Allocate idle virtual desktops to host servers

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the number of idle virtual desktops for specific host servers. The command allocates 2 idle virtual desktops for the host server named RDS-WKS-A26.contoso.com, and 4 idle virtual desktops for the host server named RDS-WKS-A27.contoso.com.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the export path for virtual desktop templates.
The Set-RDVirtualDesktopTemplateExportPath cmdlet sets the path that Remote Desktop Services uses to export virtual desktop templates for the virtual machine-based desktop deployment.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a remote desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies the path for exported virtual desktop templates.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a remote desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies the path for exported virtual desktop templates.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Set the export path for virtual export templates

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the export path for virtual desktop templates to \\rdsh-1\export.

maml:description.maml:para: Assigns a workspace name for a Remote Desktop deployment.

The Set-RDWorkspace cmdlet assigns a workspace name for a Remote Desktop deployment. Users see this name in their RemoteApp and Desktop Connection environment and their Remote Desktop Web Access (RD Web Access) environment.
Specifies a workspace name.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a Remote Desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a Remote Desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies a workspace name.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Assign a workspace name

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command assigns the workspace name Contoso Resources for the Remote Desktop deployment that has the current computer as an RD Connection Broker server. To specify a different RD Connection Broker server, use the ConnectionBroker parameter.

maml:description.maml:para: Stops a job on a virtual desktop collection.

The Stop-RDVirtualDesktopCollectionJob cmdlet forcibly ends a job that the server is currently running, or that is scheduled to run, on a virtual desktop collection. You can use the Get-RDVirtualDesktopCollectionJobStatus to get status information for the most recent job on a virtual desktop collection.
Specifies the name of a virtual desktop collection.

Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for a remote desktop deployment. If you do not specify a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command stops a job on the virtual desktop collection named Virtual Desktop Pool that is associated with the RD Connection Broker server named rdcb.contoso.com.

maml:description.maml:para: Verifies that the Remote Desktop Connection Broker server can access an Active Directory Domain Services organizational unit.
The Test-RDOUAccess cmdlet verifies that the RD Connection Broker server has access to the organizational units (OUs) in a given domain of Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).
The RD Connection Broker must have Read access to an OU to query user account information.
Specifies the Active Directory (AD) domain for which to verify access.
Specifies one or more OUs for which to verify access.
Specifies an RD Connection Broker server for a remote desktop deployment. If you do not supply a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies an RD Connection Broker server for a remote desktop deployment. If you do not supply a value, the cmdlet uses the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local computer.
Specifies the Active Directory (AD) domain for which to verify access.
Specifies one or more OUs for which to verify access.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Verify access to an OU

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command tests access to an OU named Computers by the RD Connection Broker server named Rdcb.Contoso.com.

maml:description.maml:para: Detects whether the RD Connection Broker server is configured to reuse existing AD DS computer accounts.

The Test-RDVirtualDesktopADMachineAccountReuse cmdlet detects whether the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server is configured to reuse existing Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) computer accounts when you create new virtual machines in a managed virtual desktop collection.
Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for this remote desktop deployment. If not supplied, defaults to the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local host.
Specifies the Remote Desktop Connection Broker (RD Connection Broker) server for this remote desktop deployment. If not supplied, defaults to the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the local host.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Detect whether account reuse is configured

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command detects whether the RD Connection Broker server is configured to reuse existing AD DS computer accounts when you create new virtual machines in a managed virtual desktop collection.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Update a virtual desktop collection

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command updates the virtual desktop collection named Virtual Desktop pool with the virtual desktop template named RDS-Template on the host server named rdvh-1.contoso.com.

The command specifies that the server ends the session if the update operation is still running at 12:00am. The command disables the rollback of a virtual desktop deployment and specifies that the server forces a password update for the computer account for a virtual desktop after 31 days.
